ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: When unfamiliar visitors came to your home, would you/your child hide or leave the room?
Notes: 0 = no/hardly ever;  1 = some of the time; 2 = yes/most of the time; 3 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: At school, did you/your child tend to stand back and watch other children play?
Notes: 0 = no/hardly ever;  1 = some of the time; 2 = yes/most of the time; 3 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: Were you/your child reluctant to go to school on your first day or the first day after holidays?
Notes: 0 = no/hardly ever;  1 = some of the time; 2 = yes/most of the time; 3 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: Did you/your child prefer parties with crowds of children rather than small gatherings?
Notes: 3 = no/hardly ever;  2 = some of the time; 1 = yes/most of the time; 0 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: Were you/your child always "on the go"?
Notes: 3 = no/hardly ever;  2 = some of the time; 1 = yes/most of the time; 0 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: When unfamiliar visitors came to your home, did you/your child feel fearful or nervy?
Notes: 0 = no/hardly ever;  1 = some of the time; 2 = yes/most of the time; 3 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: When you/your child went on outings with your family to new places, would you/your child tend to wander off?
Notes: 3 = no/hardly ever;  2 = some of the time; 1 = yes/most of the time; 0 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: Were you/your child fearful around other people's pets?
Notes: 0 = no/hardly ever;  1 = some of the time; 2 = yes/most of the time; 3 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: At school, did you/your child find it difficult to approach and play with new children?
Notes: 0 = no/hardly ever;  1 = some of the time; 2 = yes/most of the time; 3 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: When you/your child went on outings with your family to new places, would you/your child spend most of the time next to your mother or father (or caregiver)?
Notes: 0 = no/hardly ever;  1 = some of the time; 2 = yes/most of the time; 3 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: Did you/your child want to be surrounded by people and activity?
Notes: 3 = no/hardly ever;  2 = some of the time; 1 = yes/most of the time; 0 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: Do you/your child consider that you/your child were a shy child?
Notes: 0 = no/hardly ever;  1 = some of the time; 2 = yes/most of the time; 3 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: Did you/your child tend to take risks during play, sport or other physical activities?
Notes: 3 = no/hardly ever;  2 = some of the time; 1 = yes/most of the time; 0 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: Was it difficult for you/your child to stand up in front of the class?
Notes: 0 = no/hardly ever;  1 = some of the time; 2 = yes/most of the time; 3 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: Were you/your child outgoing and talkative with other children?
Notes: 3 = no/hardly ever; 2 = some of the time; 1 = yes/most of the time; 0 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: When you/your child went on outings with your family to new places, would you/your child become quiet or "freeze up"?
Notes: 0 = no/hardly ever;  1 = some of the time; 2 = yes/most of the time; 3 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: Did you/your child cry during the school day?
Notes: 0 = no/hardly ever;  1 = some of the time; 2 = yes/most of the time; 3 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: When unfamiliar visitors came to your home, would you/your child cling to your mother or father (or caregiver)?
Notes: 0 = no/hardly ever;  1 = some of the time; 2 = yes/most of the time; 3 = do not remember at all; 999 = missing data

ElementDescription: RMBI Fearful inhibition scale
RMBI Non approach scale
RMBI Risk avoidance scale
RMBI Shyness and sensitivity scale
RMBI Total score
Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2

ElementDescription: Respondent
Notes: NA=Not Applicable
